verses.kjv: The word that came to Jeremiah from the LORD, saying,
verses.ct: This is the message that came to Jeremiah from the LORD:

verses.kjv: Thus speaketh the LORD God of Israel, saying, Write thee all the words that I have spoken unto thee in a book.
verses.ct: The LORD, the God of Israel, says this: "Write down everything I have told you in a book."

verses.kjv: For, lo, the days come, saith the LORD, that I will bring again the captivity of my people Israel and Judah, saith the LORD: and I will cause them to return to the land that I gave to their fathers, and they shall possess it.
verses.ct: "Because the time is coming," declares the LORD, "when I will restore my people Israel and Judah from captivity," says the LORD. "I will bring them back to the land I gave to their ancestors, and they will take possession of it."

verses.kjv: And these are the words that the LORD spake concerning Israel and concerning Judah.
verses.ct: These are the words the LORD spoke about Israel and Judah.

verses.kjv: For thus saith the LORD; We have heard a voice of trembling, of fear, and not of peace.
verses.ct: The LORD says this: "We have heard cries of panic — terror, not peace."

verses.kjv: Ask ye now, and see whether a man doth travail with child? wherefore do I see every man with his hands on his loins, as a woman in travail, and all faces are turned into paleness?
verses.ct: "Go ahead and ask — can a man give birth to a child? Then why do I see every man gripping his stomach like a woman in labor, with every face drained of color?"

verses.kjv: Alas! for that day is great, so that none is like it: it is even the time of Jacob’s trouble, but he shall be saved out of it.
verses.ct: "What a terrible day that will be! There has never been anything like it. It is the time of Jacob's distress — but he will be rescued from it."

verses.kjv: For it shall come to pass in that day, saith the LORD of hosts, that I will break his yoke from off thy neck, and will burst thy bonds, and strangers shall no more serve themselves of him:
verses.ct: "On that day," declares the LORD of hosts, "I will shatter the yoke from your neck and snap your chains, and foreigners will no longer enslave my people."

verses.kjv: But they shall serve the LORD their God, and David their king, whom I will raise up unto them.
verses.ct: "Instead, they will serve the LORD their God and David their king, whom I will raise up for them."

verses.kjv: Therefore fear thou not, O my servant Jacob, saith the LORD; neither be dismayed, O Israel: for, lo, I will save thee from afar, and thy seed from the land of their captivity; and Jacob shall return, and shall be in rest, and be quiet, and none shall make him afraid.
verses.ct: "So don't be afraid, my servant Jacob," declares the LORD, "and don't be discouraged, Israel. Pay attention — I will rescue you from distant lands, and your descendants from the countries where they are held captive. Jacob will return and live in peace and security, and no one will threaten him."

verses.kjv: For I am with thee, saith the LORD, to save thee: though I make a full end of all nations whither I have scattered thee, yet will I not make a full end of thee: but I will correct thee in measure, and will not leave thee altogether unpunished.
verses.ct: "I am with you to rescue you," declares the LORD. "Even though I completely destroy all the nations where I scattered you, I will not completely destroy you. But I will discipline you fairly, and I certainly will not let you go unpunished."

verses.kjv: For thus saith the LORD, Thy bruise is incurable, and thy wound is grievous.
verses.ct: The LORD says this: "Your injury cannot be healed, and your wound is severe."

verses.kjv: There is none to plead thy cause, that thou mayest be bound up: thou hast no healing medicines.
verses.ct: "No one is there to argue your case or bandage your wounds. You have no remedy."

verses.kjv: All thy lovers have forgotten thee; they seek thee not; for I have wounded thee with the wound of an enemy, with the chastisement of a cruel one, for the multitude of thine iniquity; because thy sins were increased.
verses.ct: "All your allies have forgotten you — they don't even look for you. I struck you the way an enemy would, with harsh punishment, because your guilt was so enormous and your sins were so many."

verses.kjv: Why criest thou for thine affliction? thy sorrow is incurable for the multitude of thine iniquity: because thy sins were increased, I have done these things unto thee.
verses.ct: "Why do you cry out over your suffering? Your pain cannot be healed because your guilt was so enormous and your sins were so many — that is why I have done these things to you."

verses.kjv: Therefore all they that devour thee shall be devoured; and all thine adversaries, every one of them, shall go into captivity; and they that spoil thee shall be a spoil, and all that prey upon thee will I give for a prey.
verses.ct: "But everyone who devours you will themselves be devoured, and all your enemies — every last one — will go into captivity. Those who plunder you will be plundered, and everyone who preys on you I will make into prey."

verses.kjv: For I will restore health unto thee, and I will heal thee of thy wounds, saith the LORD; because they called thee an Outcast, saying, This is Zion, whom no man seeketh after.
verses.ct: "I will restore your health and heal your wounds," declares the LORD, "because they called you an outcast, saying, 'This is Zion — nobody cares about her.'"

verses.kjv: Thus saith the LORD; Behold, I will bring again the captivity of Jacob’s tents, and have mercy on his dwellingplaces; and the city shall be builded upon her own heap, and the palace shall remain after the manner thereof.
verses.ct: The LORD says this: "Look, I will restore Jacob's people from captivity and show mercy to their homes. The city will be rebuilt on its own ruins, and the fortress will stand in its proper place."

verses.kjv: And out of them shall proceed thanksgiving and the voice of them that make merry: and I will multiply them, and they shall not be few; I will also glorify them, and they shall not be small.
verses.ct: "Songs of gratitude and sounds of celebration will pour out from them. I will increase their numbers so they will not be few, and I will honor them so they will not be insignificant."

verses.kjv: Their children also shall be as aforetime, and their congregation shall be established before me, and I will punish all that oppress them.
verses.ct: "Their children will thrive as they did in earlier times, and their community will be established in my presence. I will punish everyone who oppresses them."

verses.kjv: And their nobles shall be of themselves, and their governor shall proceed from the midst of them; and I will cause him to draw near, and he shall approach unto me: for who is this that engaged his heart to approach unto me? saith the LORD.
verses.ct: "Their leader will come from among their own people, and their ruler will emerge from their midst. I will invite him to come close, and he will approach me — because who would dare to approach me on their own?" declares the LORD.

verses.kjv: And ye shall be my people, and I will be your God.
verses.ct: "You will be my people, and I will be your God."

verses.kjv: Behold, the whirlwind of the LORD goeth forth with fury, a continuing whirlwind: it shall fall with pain upon the head of the wicked.
verses.ct: Look — the LORD's storm is unleashed with fury, a driving whirlwind that will crash down on the heads of the wicked.

verses.kjv: The fierce anger of the LORD shall not return, until he have done it, and until he have performed the intents of his heart: in the latter days ye shall consider it.
verses.ct: The LORD's burning anger will not turn back until he has finished and carried out the purposes of his heart. In the days to come, you will understand this clearly.
